results.name: a(n) = Lucas(n) + (-1)^n.
comment: Let phi = 1/2*(1 + sqrt(5)) denote the golden ratio and put c = sum {n = 1..inf} 1/2^floor(n*(phi + 2)). The bicimal expansion of the constant c begins 0.001000100100010001001.... The binary digits are the generalized Fibonacci word A221150.

The sequence 2^a(n) for n >= 1 gives the partial quotients, apart from the first, in the simple continued fraction expansion of the constant 1/2*c = 0.06692 72114 83804 90296 ... = 1/(14 + 1/(2^0 + 1/(2^4 + 1/(2^3 + 1/(2^8 + 1/(2^10 + 1/(2^19 + ...))))))). Cf. A008346. - _Peter Bala_, Nov 06 2013
